Package hu.bme.mit.theta.core.type.arraytype

package hu.bme.mit.theta.core.type.arraytype
SMT array type and its expressions. Use ArrayExprs to create them. SMT arrays are unbounded, associative mappings from a key type to a value type.

- ArrayType: the actual array type

- ArrayLitExpr: array literal, e.g., [0 <- 182, 1 <- 41, default <- 75] - ArrayInitExpr: array init expression, e.g., [0 <- 182, 1 <- x, default <- 75]

- ArrayReadExpr: read array at an index, e.g., a[i] - ArrayWriteExpr: write array at an index, e.g., a[i <- v], the result of write is a new array, where element i is v

- ArrayEqExpr: equal - ArrayNeqExpr: not equal

    hu.bme.mit.theta.core.type
    This package contains types (e.g., Boolean, integer) and expressions operating over them (e.g., Boolean connectives, arithmetic operations), grouped into subpackages.
